FT</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Aaltonen, T.; Adelman, J.; Alvarez Gonzalez, B.; Amerio, S.; Amidei, D.; Anastassov, A.; Annovi, A.; Antos, J.; Apollinari, G.; Akimoto, T.; Albrow, M.G.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">We present a search for exclusive Z boson production in proton-antiproton collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV, using the CDF II detector at Fermilab. We observe no exclusive Z → ℓ⁺ℓ⁻ candidates and place the first upper limit on the exclusive Z cross section in hadron collisions, σ{sub excl}(Z) < 0.96 pb at 95% confidence level. In addition, we observe eight candidate exclusive dilepton events from the quantum electrodynamic process p{bar p} → pγγ{bar p} → pℓ⁺ℓ⁻ {bar p}, and measure the cross section for M{sub ℓℓ} > 40 GeV=c² and </subfield><subfield code=" ">< 4 to be σ = 0.24{sub -0.10}{sup +0.13} pb, which is the first measurement for this mass range and is consistent with the standard model prediction.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-07CH11359</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Physics Of Elementary Particles And Fields.</subfield><subfield code="2">edbsc</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Bosons.</subfield><subfield code="a">Cross Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star We present a search for exclusive Z boson production in proton-antiproton collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV, using the CDF II detector at Fermilab. We observe no exclusive Z → ℓ⁺ℓ⁻ candidates and place the first upper limit on the exclusive Z cross section in hadron collisions, σ{sub excl}(Z) < 0.96 pb at 95% confidence level. In addition, we observe eight candidate exclusive dilepton events from the quantum electrodynamic process p{bar p} → pγγ{bar p} → pℓ⁺ℓ⁻ {bar p}, and measure the cross section for M{sub ℓℓ} > 40 GeV=c² and  < 4 to be σ = 0.24{sub -0.10}{sup +0.13} pb, which is the first measurement for this mass range and is consistent with the standard model prediction. notes_summary_ssim: We present a search for exclusive Z boson production in proton-antiproton collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV, using the CDF II detector at Fermilab.
